title: With Existing Tools - Advice for Multiple-Animal Labeling?
body:
**Your Operating system and DeepLabCut version**

Please state your operating system, env, and which version of DeepLabCut you are using.
Example: Ubuntu 16.04 LTS, with an Anaconda Env, & DeepLabCut1.x or 2.x.

_Windows 10 (Anaconda, DLC 2.1.3) and Red Hat Linux 7 (Anaconda, DeepLabCut 2.1.4)_

Please complete the following information about your system:

OS: _Windows 10 (for labeling) & Red Hat Linux 7_
DeepLabCut Version: _2.1.3 for labeling, 2.1.4 otherwise_
Browser [e.g. chrome, safari]: _Firefox_

**Describe the problem**

I see several issues discussing multiple animal workflows, especially how to use scoremaps and thresholds to use a trained network to mark multiple animals. And mentions of future tooling. But my question is related to labeling multiple animals using existing tools. I was wondering if you had any advice. 

I am trying to label aerial data of multiple sharks in ocean waters. Let's say for example there are 5 sharks in an image. Using existing tools, I could label a single shark and ignore the others in the image. Or, I could copy that image 5 times and then label a different shark in each of 5 duplicate images. Do you have any thoughts on which would be more effective? Or maybe there are other strategies I haven't considered.

**Screenshots**
This a frame from one of the clearer video segments. The tagging results are a work in progress.
![Training-agg3-img090](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/5142129/69921432-761b7a80-1446-11ea-9ea3-eeca37af2139.png)
